title: Not often I use my own fonts...
content:
...in my commercial work.

In the “card industry” facet of my work they want calligraphy. In this instance I used P22 Peanut and they will never know the difference.

What I think is cool in this piece is that this scripture can be broken into three threads, in different colors, and it still maintains its flow, and the three threads are cohesive. And who says that scripture is not divinely inspired.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090505173726im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blue_5477.png)

Michael

It was done with a “Ruling Writer”

Basically it is a large bladed ruling pen. It was done on cold press watercolor paper, hence the splatter and rough edges on the letters. When raking the pen across the paper the blades become much like a tuning fork... they vibrate causing the ink to “fly.”
